Germany

Group F | Europe

Käespätzle

Reigning World Cup champions deserve a rich meal. To deliver we are taking Serious Eats spätzle to the next level with Daring Gourmet's help.

This mac & cheese inspired dish provides Manuel Neuer with all the power he needs to save all the shots fired at his goal. You will need a spätzle maker for this recipe.

  • Time 1hr 15mins
  • Makes 4
  • Difficulty Semi-Pro
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 85g Butter
    6 tbsp
    85g
    Butter
  • 2 Onions
    2
    2
    Onions diced
  • 125g Flour
    1 cup
    125g
    Flour
  • 75g Semolina flour
    ½ cup
    75g
    Semolina flour
  • 1 tsp Thyme
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Thyme finely chopped
  • 1 tsp Sage
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Sage finely chopped
  • 2 Eggs
    2
    2
    Eggs
  • 120ml Milk
    ½ cup
    120ml
    Milk
  • 170g Emmental cheese
    6oz
    170g
    Emmental cheese grated
  • 170g Gruyére cheese
    6oz
    170g
    Gruyére cheese grated
  • 1
    Start off by melting the butter on a low heat in a skillet or frying pan and adding the onions. Cook the onions for around 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  • 2
    While the onions are cooking, start the spätzle dough. Use a mixing bowl to whisk together the flour, semolina flour, thyme and sage. Season the mixture with salt and pepper.
  • 3
    In a separate bowl beat the eggs with most of the milk. Pour the mixture into the flour mix. Using the remaining milk if the dough is too thick. Leave dough to rest for 15 minutes.
  • 4
    Use a späztle maker to drop the spätzle into a saucepan of boiling water.
    Coach's tip Use about 1/4 cup of dough in the spätzle maker at a time.
    Coach's tip Use about 1/4 cup of dough in the spätzle maker at a time.
  • 5
    When the spätzle floats to the top of the water, skim out of water and then place on a sheet of kitchen paper to dry. Do this in batches until all the dough has been cooked.
  • 6
    Butter a small baking dish and add 1/2 of the spätzle, layer with 1/2 of the emmental and gruyére, followed by 1/2 of the onions. Repeat with the rest of the spätzle, cheese and onions. Top with the breadcrumbs and bake at 400°F200°C for 15 minutes.
